name: frindi
params: setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wi(wa(wss(c0, c1), wral(s0, c1, wi(wss(cpred(c2, c1, cv(s0)), c0), wcel(cv(s0), c0)))), wceq(c1, c0))

-| wfr(c2, c1)
-| wse(c2, c1)

comment: The principle of founded induction. Theorem 4.4 of Don Monk's notes (see ~ frmin ). This principle states that if ` B ` is a subclass of a founded class ` A ` with the property that every element of ` B ` whose initial segment is included in ` A ` is itself equal to ` A ` . (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 6-Feb-2011.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jun-2015.)
